sections.heading: Many Values to Multiple Variables
sections.description: Python allows you to assign values to multiple variables in one line:

code_blocks.code:
x, y, z = "Orange", "Banana", "Cherry"
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)

sections.heading: One Value to Multiple Variables
sections.description: And you can assign the same value to multiple variables in one line:

code_blocks.code:
x = y = z = "Orange"
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)

sections.heading: Unpack a Collection
sections.description: If you have a collection of values in a list, tuple etc. Python allows you to extract the values into variables. This is called unpacking. Learn more about unpacking in our Unpack Tuples Chapter.

code_blocks.code:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]

x, y, z = fruits

print(x)

print(y)

print(z)
